static size_t npos

Detailed Description

A generic value used in conjunction with HasFields.

For each of the constructors that takes in a pointer, there is a flag indicating if the new Value is the "owner" and responsible for deleting any underlying pointer references.

Due to memory-management issues, there is no copy constructor for this class.

bool  owner = false 
) [explicit]

Internal Use Only: Creates value as a HasFields*object that maps the keys/values passed in.

vrt::Value::Value ( Value *  val  )  [explicit]

Internal Use Only: Creates value that wraps another value.

This is used in a few rare situations where we need to restrict deletion of the given pointer (i.e. user can delete the new Value but not the one passed in).

vrt::Value::Value ( vector< Value * > *  val,
bool  owner = false 
)

Internal Use Only: Creates value that wraps an array of values.

Generally use of the version that takes an array of VRTObject* is preferred.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T >
T vrt::Value::as (  )  [inline]

Casts to the given type.

This will make it more likely to get a compile error rather than a core dump in cases like the error shown below: 

    Value     *val = ...;
    HasFields *hf  = NULL;
    hf = (HasFields*)val;           // **ERROR**
    hf = (HasFields*)*val;          // **OK**
    hf = val->as<HasFields*>();     // **OK**
    hf = val->as<TimeStamp*>();     // **ERROR**
    hf = val->cast<TimeStamp*>();   // **OK**
    hf = val->cast<double*>();      // **ERROR**
Value* vrt::Value::at ( size_t  i  )  const

Gets an entry from the internal vector (if a vector) otherwise returns a null value.

Referenced by operator[]().

template<typename T >
T vrt::Value::cast (  )  [inline]

Casts to the given VRTObject* type.

This is identical to using: *checked_dynamic_cast<T>(as<VRTObject*>()).

Note that the type used here MUST be a subclass of VRTObject in pointer form.
